Package bank

Class Bank

java.lang.Object
bank.Bank
public class Bank extends Object
A Bank. This class manages customers (Customer) and their accounts (Account and derived classes). All accounts and all customers managed by this class must have a unique identifier. Note: There may exist multiple customers that share the same firstname, lastname, and day of birth. Nevertheless, all customers have a unique identifier. The bank supports two different types of accounts: (i) corporate account, (ii) personal account (i) A corporate account is allowed to have a negative balance (without limit). Furthermore, a corporate bank account may be owned by multiple customers. (ii) A personal account is owned by a single customer. Furthermore, they are NOT allowed to have a negative balance.

  • Constructor Details

    • Bank

      public Bank()
      
public class Bank {
    Map customers;
    Map accounts;
    
    public Bank() {
        customers = new TreeMap();
        accounts = new TreeMap();
    }

  • Method Details

    • registerCustomer

      public String registerCustomer(String firstName, String lastName, Date birthDay)
      Creates and registers a new Customer object whose attributes correspond to the given values.
      Parameters:
      firstName - the customer's first name
      lastName - the customer's last name
      birthDay - the customer's birthday
      Returns:
      the id of the created and registered customer object
      
public String registerCustomer(String firstName, String lastName, Date birthDay) {
	Customer customer = new Customer(firstName, lastName, birthDay);
	customers.put(customer.getID(), customer);

	return customer.getID();
}

    • getCustomers

      public Collection<String> getCustomers(String firstName, String lastName, Date birthDay)
      Returns the collection of all registered customers that share the given first name and last name and are also born on the same day (i.e., they share the same date, month, and year of birth).
      Parameters:
      firstName - a first name
      lastName - a last name
      birthDay - a day of birth
      Returns:
      the (possibly empty) collection;
      
public Collection getCustomers(String firstName, String lastName, Date birthDay) {
	Collection customerIDS = new LinkedList();

	customers.forEach((k,v) -> {
		if((v.getFirstName().equals(firstName))
			&& (v.getLastName().equals(lastName))
			&& (v.getBirthDay().equals(birthDay))){
				customerIDS.add(k);
			}
	});

	return customerIDS;
}

    • removeAccount

      public boolean removeAccount(String accountId)
      removes the given account from the bank
      Parameters:
      accountId - the id of the account
      Returns:
      true if an account with the given id existed and was successfully removed; otherwise false
      
public boolean removeAccount(String accountId) {
	if((accountId != null) && (accounts.containsKey(accountId))){
		accounts.remove(accountId);
		return true;
	}

	return false;
}

    • registerCorporateAccount

      public Optional<String> registerCorporateAccount(String... customerId)
      creates and registers a new CorporateAccount where the customers with the given customerIds shall be owners of the account. Note: A corporate account may have a negative balance. Note: Corporate accounts may be owned by multiple customers
      Parameters:
      customerId - the identifiers of already registered customers who will be the owners of the account
      Returns:
      the unique id of the newly created account as an Optional; the Optional is empty if at least one of the customers is not registered in the bank
      
public Optional registerCorporateAccount(String... customerId) {
	if(customerId == null)
		return Optional.empty();

	for(String customer : customerId){
		if((customer == null) || (!customers.containsKey(customer)))	//customer not registered
			return Optional.empty();
	}

	Account account = new CorporateAccount(new BigDecimal(0), customerId);
	accounts.put(account.getID(), account);

	return Optional.of(account.getID());
}

    • registerPersonalAccount

      public Optional<String> registerPersonalAccount(String customerId)
      creates and registers a new PersonalAccount where customer with the given customerId shall be the owner of the account. Note: A personal account must never have a negative balance.
      Parameters:
      customerId - the identifier of an already registered customer who will be the owner of the account
      Returns:
      the unique id of the newly created account as an Optional; the Optional is empty if the customer with the specified id is not registered in the bank
      
public Optional registerPersonalAccount(String customerId) {
	if((customerId == null) || (!customers.containsKey(customerId)))	//customer not registered
		return Optional.empty();

	Account account = new PersonalAccount(new BigDecimal(0), customerId);
	accounts.put(account.getID(), account);

	return Optional.of(account.getID());
}

    • getBalance

      public Optional<BigDecimal> getBalance(String accountId)
      Returns the balance of the account with the given id
      Parameters:
      accountId - the id of the account
      Returns:
      the balance of the account as an Optional; the Optional is empty if no account for this id is registered
      
public Optional getBalance(String accountId) {
	if((accountId == null) || (!accounts.containsKey(accountId)))
		return Optional.empty();

	return Optional.of(accounts.get(accountId).getBalance());
}

    • deposit

      public boolean deposit(String accountId, BigDecimal amount)
      Deposit operation. Adds the given amount to the account with the specified id
      Parameters:
      accountId - the id of the account
      amount - the amount that shall be deposited
      Returns:
      true iff the amount was successfully deposited; false otherwise
      
public boolean deposit(String accountId, BigDecimal amount) {
	if((accountId == null) || (amount == null))
		return false;

	Account acc = accounts.get(accountId);
	if(acc == null)
		return false;

	acc.deposit(amount);

	return true;
}

    • withdraw

      public boolean withdraw(String accountId, BigDecimal amount)
      Widthdraw operation. Substracts the given amount from the account with the specified id
      Parameters:
      accountId - the id of the account
      amount - the amount that shall be widhdrawn
      Returns:
      true iff the amount was successfully withdrawn; false otherwise
      
public boolean withdraw(String accountId, BigDecimal amount) {
	if((accountId == null) || (amount == null))
		return false;

	Account acc = accounts.get(accountId);

	if(acc == null)
		return false;

	return acc.withdraw(amount);
}

    • transfer

      public boolean transfer(String fromAccountId, String toAccountId, BigDecimal amount)
      Transfer operation. Transfers the given amount between the accounts with the specified ids
      Parameters:
      fromAccountId - the id of the account from which the money is transfered
      toAccountId - the id of the account to which the money is transfered to
      amount - the amount that shall be transfered
      Returns:
      true iff the transfer operation was performed successfully; false otherwise
      
public boolean transfer(String fromAccountId, String toAccountId, BigDecimal amount) {
	if(!withdraw(fromAccountId, amount))
		return false;

	if(!deposit(toAccountId, amount)){
		//give money back
		deposit(fromAccountId, amount);
		return false;
	}

	return true;
}

    • getAccounts

      public Optional<Collection<String>> getAccounts(String customerId)
      Returns the collection of accounts that are owned by the customer with the given id
      Parameters:
      customerId - the id of the owning customer
      Returns:
      the (potentially empty) collection of accounts (e.g., a list) as an Optional; the Optional is empty if no customer with the given id is registered
      
public Optional> getAccounts(String customerId) {
	Collection accountIDs = new LinkedList();

	if((customerId == null) || (customers.get(customerId) == null))
		return Optional.empty();

	//go through all owners for all accounts
	accounts.forEach((k,v) -> {
		for(String owner : v.owner)
			if(owner.equals(customerId))
				accountIDs.add(k);
	});
	
	return Optional.of(accountIDs);
}

    • getTotalBalance

      public Optional<BigDecimal> getTotalBalance(String customerId)
      Returns the total balance of all accounts owned by the customer with the specified id
      Parameters:
      customerId - the id of the customer
      Returns:
      the sum of all accounts owned by the customer as an Optional; the Optional is empty if no customer with the given id is registered
      
public Optional getTotalBalance(String customerId) {
	BigDecimal total = new BigDecimal(0);
	Collection accountIDs;

	//check if customer exists
	if((customerId == null) || (customers.get(customerId) == null))
		return Optional.empty();

		
	//get all accounts for a customer
	Optional> accIDsOrEmpty = getAccounts(customerId);
	accountIDs = accIDsOrEmpty.orElseGet(null);

	if(accountIDs == null)
		return Optional.empty();


	for(String accID : accountIDs){
		total = total.add(accounts.get(accID).getBalance());
	}
		
	return Optional.of(total);
}
